conclusion: Consider forces acting on each block and relationship between applied force F, acceleration, and static friction force.
Block A, B, C, D are connected by a spring and placed on a smooth surface.
Identify forces acting on each block: Force F applied by the spring.
Apply Newton's second law: F = ma for each block.
Total force F is the same for all blocks since they are identical.
Net force acting on each block must be zero since blocks accelerate together.
Net force is sum of forces exerted by spring and applied force F.
Force exerted by spring on each block is F.
Force exerted by applied force F on each block is F.
Net force acting on each block is zero since blocks accelerate together.
Force exerted by applied force F must equal force exerted by spring on each block.
Force exerted by spring on each block is F.
Force exerted by spring on each block must be the same since blocks are identical.
Force exerted by spring on each block is F.
Force exerted by applied force F on each block is F.
